content:
The provided code snippet is part of the `InputState` class, which manages input states by allowing components to force specific states or handle user inputs. The highlighted chunk occurs within the `force` method, specifically handling error logging when a component attempts to force an input state to OFF while it's already being forced ON by another source. This ensures conflicts are detected and logged, maintaining robust state management.

"%s is trying to force '%s' to OFF, but '%s' is already being forced ON by %s" %
                    (inputSource, name, name, self._forcingOn[name])
                )
            self._forcingOff.setdefault(name, set())
            self._forcingOff[name].add(inputSource)
        return token
